properties.name: BridgePort Brewery
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing  1313 NW Marshall Street, Portland, ORMaking beer since 1984. Free tours are offered 2 pm and 5pm Monday-Friday and 2 pm, 3pm, and 5pm Saturday-Sunday. The brewery is in an old cordage factory. The brew pub is right next door.

properties.name: Concordia Brewery
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing   5736 NE 33rd, Portland, OR 97211 Named for the neighborhood in which it is located, this brewery opened as part of the rejuvenated Kennedy school in 1997. It is housed in the former little girls\' room of the old school, and features artwork depicting the history of beer making as well s the antics of school girls. On the fermentation tanks are portrayed some of Kennedy School\'s no-nonsense principals. Old Schoolhouse Pale Ale debuted in 1997 in honor of the reopening of this neighborhood landmark.

properties.name: Full Sail Brewing Co.
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing  307 SW Montgomery St, Portland, ORIndependent, employee-owned brew pub.

properties.name: Future Lucky Lab BrewPub
properties.description: Posted by Jason 1925 nw quimby st, portlandThey\'re renting some office space in half the building, their SE location is very cool.

properties.name: Hillsdale Brewery
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing   1505 SW Sunset Blvd., Portland, OR 97201 Oregon\'s first brewpub since Prohibition days, the Hillsdale\'s inaugural brew was made in October 1985. The initial brewers crafted McMenamins\' first unfiltered wheat ales and the first fruit ales (starting with blackberries scavenged from the vines off the parking lot). The Hillsdale is also notable for staging in the mid-1980s what likely was the first microbrew festival in Oregon. Today, the Hillsdale Brewfest, held every February, is considered the Grandaddy of all McMenamins brew fests. Another first at the Hillsdale was Alex Farnum, who was certainly the first female brewer to work for McMenamins and may well have been the first female brewer in Oregon.

properties.name: Lucky Labrador
properties.description: Posted by Deisnor  915 SE Hawthorne Blvd., Portland, ORDog friendly, dog-insired 21+ after 9pm

properties.name: MacTarnahan's Brewery
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing  2730 NW 31st Ave, 97210No tours, but 12 beers in the taproom and a view onto the copper tanks hauled over from a Bavarian monestary.

properties.name: Oak Hills Brewery
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing   14740 NW Cornell Rd, Ste 80, Portland, OR 97229Launched in the foothills of Beaverton in 1990, the Oak Hills brewpub has evolved into one of the companys primary training grounds for brewers. Many memorable brews have sprung from its fermenters -- including Rhino Stout and It Goes to 11 (Spinal Tap barleywine) -- Oak Hills also has the dubious distinction of producing one of the worst beers the company has ever served: Afterburner. A highly hopped ale infused with even a higher concentration of garlic - four pounds of garlic to be exact! It was an experiment conducted with the best intentions but one that had truly monstrous results.

properties.name: Old Market Pub and Brewery
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing  6959 SW Multnomah Blvd Ste 101, Portland, OROccupying the space originally designed and built for Comella\'s and Son Market, the pub retains small flourishes of the past. Live plants are suspended by original 1950s produce scales above lacquered pine tables. Old-time wooden signs, large booths and a laid-back atmosphere set the tone for sports fans at the bar and conversation everywhere else. (Citysearch)

properties.name: Widmer Brothers Brewing Company
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing  929 N Russell, Portland, ORBrothers Kurt and Rob Widmer founded Widmer Brothers Brewing Company back in 1984, and have been brewing deliciously authentic European and American style beers for over 20 years. Widmer brews beer in Portland, Oregon, where they know a thing or two about good beer. America’s Original Hefeweizen. Check website for tour hours
